脫.definition: to shed; to take off; to escape; to get away from

脫不了身.definition: busy and unable to get away

脫亞入歐.definition: to abandon the old (Asian) ways and learn from Europe; refers to the ideas that led to the Meiji Restoration and Japan's subsequent colonization projects in Asia

脫光.definition: to strip naked; to strip nude; (coll.) to find oneself a partner

脫出.definition: to break away; to extricate; to escape; to leave the confines of

脫口而出.definition: (idiom) to blurt out; to let slip (an indiscreet remark)

脫咖啡因.definition: decaffeinated; decaf; see also 無咖啡因|无咖啡因[wu2 ka1 fei1 yin1]

脫孝.definition: to get through the mourning period

脫崗.definition: to take time off; to take leave (e.g. for study); to skive off work

脫手.definition: (not of regular commerce) to sell or dispose of (goods etc); to get rid of; to unload

脫掉.definition: to remove; to take off; to strip off; to discard; to shed; to come off; to fall off

脫支.definition: de-Sinicization and rejection of Han culture

脫敏.definition: to desensitize; to become desensitized; to anonymize (data); to remove sensitive content

脫星.definition: actress or actor known for having been photographed in the nude or for appearing in sexy scenes

脫期.definition: to fail to come out on time; to miss a deadline

脫歐.definition: to withdraw from the European Union; abbr. for 脫離歐盟|脱离欧盟

脫殼.definition: to break out of an eggshell; to molt; to remove the husk; to shell

脫毛.definition: to lose hair or feathers; to molt; depilation; to shave

脫氧核糖核酸.pinyin: tuo1 yang3 he2 tang2 he2 suan1

脫水.definition: to dry out; to extract water; dehydration; dehydrated; desiccation

脫水機.definition: a device for extracting water (such as a centrifuge)

脫泥.definition: to remove mud; desliming (in coal production)

脫淺.definition: to refloat (a boat that has run aground)

脫滑.definition: to shirk; to try to get off work; to slide on the job

脫產.definition: to transfer (from production to other duties); to take leave (for study or other job); to dispose of property; to transfer assets (to avoid liability)

脫略.definition: unrestrained; throwing off strictures; unrespectful; indulgence

脫皮.definition: (of paint etc) to peel off; to flake off; (of an insect or snake etc) to molt; (of skin) to peel off due to hard labor, blistering or sunburn etc; (fig.) to go through a grueling experience

脫皮掉肉.definition: lit. to shed skin, drop flesh; to work as hard as possible; to work one's butt off

脫盲.definition: to acquire literacy; to throw off blindness

脫稿.definition: (of a manuscript) to be completed; to do without prepared notes (when giving a speech)

脫穎而出.definition: to reveal one's talent (idiom); to rise above others; to distinguish oneself

脫空.definition: to fail; to come to nothing; to fall through (of plans, hopes); to lie

脫窗.definition: (Tw) cross-eyed (from Taiwanese 挩窗, Tai-lo pr. [thuah-thang])

脫線.definition: derailment; to jump the track (of train); to derail

脫羽.definition: to shed feathers; to molt (of birds)

脫胎.definition: to be born; (fig.) to develop out of sth else (of ideas, stories, political systems etc); (fig.) to shed one's body (to be reborn); bodiless (e.g. lacquerware)

脫胎換骨.definition: to shed one's mortal body and exchange one's bones (idiom); born again Daoist; to turn over a new leaf; fig. to change wholly; to create from other material (story, artwork etc)

脫脫.definition: Toktoghan (1314-1355), Mongol politician during the Yuan dynasty, prime minister until 1345, compiled three dynastic histories of Song 宋史, Liao 遼史|辽史 and Jin 金史; also written Tuoketuo 托克托

脫膠.definition: (of parts glued together) to come apart

脫色.definition: to lose color; to turn pale; to bleach; to fade

脫落.definition: to drop off; to fall off; (of hair, teeth etc) to fall out; to omit (a character when writing)

脫褲子放屁.definition: lit. to take off trousers to fart; fig. to do something absolutely unnecessary; fig. to make things too complicated

脫貧.definition: to lift oneself out of poverty

脫貧致富.definition: to rise from poverty and become prosperous (idiom); poverty alleviation

脫身.definition: to get away; to escape (from obligations); to free oneself; to disengage

脫軌.definition: to leave the rails; to derail; to jump the track

脫鉤.definition: to cut ties; to disconnect; out of touch

脫銷.definition: to sell out; to run out (of supplies); deficient; lack of supplies

脫離.definition: to separate oneself from; to break away from; diastasis (medicine); abscission; abjunction (botany)

脫離危險.definition: out of danger; to avoid danger

脫離苦海.definition: to escape from the abyss of suffering; to shed off a wretched plight

脫靶.definition: to miss; to shoot and miss the target; off the mark

脫韁.definition: (of a horse etc) to break free from the reins; (fig.) to become unconstrained

脫韁之馬.definition: lit. a horse that has thrown off the reins (idiom); runaway horse; out of control

脫韁野馬.definition: a wild horse that refuses to be bridled (a metaphor for sth that runs wild)

脫骨換胎.definition: to shed one's mortal body and exchange one's bones (idiom); born again Daoist; to turn over a new leaf; fig. to change wholly

脫髮.definition: to lose one's hair; hair loss; alopecia

脫黨.definition: to leave a political party; to give up party membership
